Rules of the game Blokus Classic

- A board with 20 * 20 squares. 
- 4 players each have 21 pieces: 1 single-square, 1 domino, 2 triominos, 5 tetraminos, and 12 pentaminos. 
- As a player, you have to place as many pieces on the board as possible. 
- For the first piece, you must place a piece so that it touches one of the corners of the board. 
- Next, a piece must be placed so that it touches a corner of one of your own pieces. It may touch several corners, but never your pieces' sides!

- If you cannot place any more pieces, your game is over. \n- The end of the game is reached when every player either runs out of pieces to place, or cannot place any more pieces. \n- Score is calculated by the addition of all the squares of the pieces you place.
How to play with Blokish Android app
Smooth Drag&Drop and swipe gestures to place the pieces. \n- Scroll through your remaining pieces with your finger from left to right.
- Select and drag a piece onto the board. You can now drag it around, easily putting the finger on the large grey circle.
- Rotate the piece using one of the handles.

- You can flip the piece to its mirror position with a long press. 
Flipping a piece can also be done using the menu (useful for tablets). 
- You can cancel with the red button. It will move the piece back to the bottom. 
- When the move is valid, a green 'ok' button appears. You can commit the move by clicking it!

- At any time you can see your opponents\' remaining pieces. Just select the corresponding color at the bottom. \n- When you win against the machine, you can select a harder level via the Menu > Preferences.
